Author: Key-Monk6159

Comment: Also, intention to join NATO is not the same as being a part of NATO, just like negotiating with random Dems behind the scenes is not the same as negotiating with our current executive.  We've been *telling them no* for ages and the state of their application is only marginally better than it's ever been, but the left keeps spinning things like they're already a full member with full benefits. Ukraine needs elections, saying 'no election in a time of war' is a bad match with **fighting indefinitely.**   Their government wants to fight to the last drop, they want their fight to be our fight, and they also give us flak when we try to make economic deals. They're not acting like they're our friend or partner, they're acting like they can swipe a card all through town and the card is our responsibility.

Author: Key-Monk6159

Comment: I feel like your side is always intentionally vague with your comments. Please say exactly what you're proposing. Direct intervention? Massive amounts of aid? What would satisfy you? The latter won't get Ukraine its territory back, and will cost Ukraine more lives and their future economic situation in the process. The former would put the world's two nuclear powers directly at war, and would be sending American fathers and sons to die fighting a country that has proven itself to be no real threat to the USA geopolitically (unless we're forgetting that they're failing to conquer an impoverished country they share a massive border with after years of all-out warfare).  I do not see a single path in continuing this war that benefits the USA or Ukraine.
